com.pb.sawdust.tabledata

Interface DataRow

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ContextDataRow<C>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDataRow, BasicDataRow, DegenerateContextDataRow, WrappedDataRow

    public interface DataRow

    The DataRow interface provides a framework through which rows of a DataTable can be accessed. It allows access to greater row information than would a simple list of row data. It does not require any explicit connection to a data table, which both simplifies the interface and allows it to be independant of a data source (though column labels, types and cardinality, as well as table indices provide an implicit link to the parent data table).

    • Method Detail

      • getColumnLabels

        java.lang.String[] getColumnLabels()
        Get the column labels, ordered as they are in this data row.
        Returns:
        this data row's column labels.

      • getColumnLabel

        java.lang.String getColumnLabel(int columnIndex)
        Get the label of a column at a specified index.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The (0-based) index whose column label is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the column label corresponding to the column at columnIndex
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if the column index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of columns in this data row.

      • hasColumn

        boolean hasColumn(java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Determine whether this data row has a column with a specified label.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The column label whose presence is to be queried.
        Returns:
        true if this data row has a column with the specified label, false otherwise.

      • getColumnIndex

        int getColumnIndex(java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Get the index of the column with a specified label. Indices are 0-based, for reasons described in DataTable.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The label of the column whose index is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the (0-based) index of the column corresponding to columnLabel.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if no column corresponding to columnLabel exists.

      • getColumnTypes

        DataType[] getColumnTypes()
        Get the column types, ordered as they are in this data row.
        Returns:
        this data row's column types.

      • getColumnType

        DataType getColumnType(int columnIndex)
        Get the data type of the column at a specified index. Indices are 0-based, for reasons described in DataTable.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The (0-based) index of the column whose type is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the data type of the column corresponding to columnIndex.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if the column index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of columns in this data row.

      • getColumnType

        DataType getColumnType(java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Get the data type of the column with a specified label.
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The label of the column whose type is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the data type of the column corresponding to columnLabel.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if no column corresponding to columnLabel exists.

      • getData

        java.lang.Object[] getData()
        Get the elements of this data row as an array. Because each data element may be of a different type, the returned data array is a generic Object array; to cast each element to its true class the column type information available in the getColumnType methods can be used.
        Returns:
        the elements of this data row.

      • getCell

        <T> T getCell(int columnIndex)
        Get the row value at a specified column index. If the type parameter T is specified, then it must match the data column's type (the class of T must match getColumnType(columnIndex).getObjectClass()).
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The (0-based) index of the column whose value is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the value of the column corresponding to columnIndex.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if the column index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of columns in this data row.

      • getCell

        <T> T getCell(java.lang.String columnLabel)
        Get the row value at a column with the specified label. If the type parameter T is specified, then it must match the data column's type (the class of T must match getColumnType(columnLabel).getObjectClass()).
        Parameters:
        columnLabel - The label of the column whose value is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the value of the column corresponding to columnLabel.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if no column corresponding to columnLabel exists.

      • getCellAsByte

        byte getCellAsByte(int columnIndex)
        Get the row value at a specified column index as a byte. The value must be convertible to a byte (or byte) or an exception will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        columnIndex - The (0-based) index of the column whose value is to be retrieved.
        Returns:
        the value of the column corresponding to columnIndex.
        Throws:
        TableDataException - if the column index is less than 0 or greater than or equal to the number of columns in this data row, or if the cell value cannot be converted to a byte}.

      • getCellAsByte

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getIndexValues

        java.lang.Object[] getIndexValues(TableIndex index)
        Get the column values from this row corresponding to a given index. The column values should be ordered as the columns are in the index.
        Parameters:
        index - The table index.
        Returns:
        the column values corresponding to index.

      • willCoerceData

        boolean willCoerceData()
        Indicates whether this data table will attempt to coerce data to the correct types when getting. This will be inherited from the row's parent DataTable at the time of creation.
        Returns:
        true if data will be coerced, false otherwise.
